action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: This is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word to gather initial feedback.
guess: apple

attempts = 1
target_word = micro
guess = apple
guess_feedback = a<red> p<red> p<red> l<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: a<red> p<red> p<red> l<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: All letters in "apple" are incorrect, so I will exclude these letters and try a completely different word.
guess: chord

attempts = 2
target_word = micro
guess = chord
guess_feedback = c<yellow> h<red> o<yellow> r<green> d<red>

guess_feedback: c<yellow> h<red> o<yellow> r<green> d<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback indicates that "r" is correct and in the right position (green), "c" and "o" are correct but misplaced (yellow), and "h" and "d" are incorrect. I will use this to form a new guess.
guess: croak

attempts = 3
target_word = micro
guess = croak
guess_feedback = c<yellow> r<yellow> o<yellow> a<red> k<red>

guess_feedback: c<yellow> r<yellow> o<yellow> a<red> k<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback shows that "c," "r," and "o" are correct but misplaced. I will rearrange these letters and avoid using "a" and "k," which are incorrect.
guess: orcry
Guesser Error: NOT_VALID_WORD_FOR_GAME while parsing Player 1's (model: qwen-max) response

Your guess is not a valid word for this game. Please try again.

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: My previous guess was invalid. I will now try a valid word that fits the feedback, keeping "c," "r," and "o" in mind but rearranging them.
guess: corry
Guesser Error: NOT_VALID_WORD_FOR_GAME while parsing Player 1's (model: qwen-max) response

Your guess is not a valid word for this game. Please try again.

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: My previous attempts included invalid words. I will now use a valid word that incorporates "c," "r," and "o" while avoiding invalid letters.
guess: torso

attempts = 4
target_word = micro
guess = torso
guess_feedback = t<red> o<red> r<yellow> s<red> o<green>

guess_feedback: t<red> o<red> r<yellow> s<red> o<green>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback shows that "o" is correct and in the right position (green), "r" is correct but misplaced (yellow), and "t" and "s" are incorrect. I will use this to refine my guess.
guess: rotor

attempts = 5
target_word = micro
guess = rotor
guess_feedback = r<yellow> o<yellow> t<red> o<red> r<red>

guess_feedback: r<yellow> o<yellow> t<red> o<red> r<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback indicates that "o" is correct but misplaced, and "r" is correct but misplaced. I will avoid using "t" and try a new arrangement of "r" and "o" while introducing new letters.
guess: orcas

attempts = 6
target_word = micro
guess = orcas
guess_feedback = o<yellow> r<yellow> c<green> a<red> s<red>
game_result = LOSS

guess_explanation: This is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word to gather initial feedback.
All letters in "apple" are incorrect, so I will exclude these letters and try a completely different word.
The feedback indicates that "r" is correct and in the right position (green), "c" and "o" are correct but misplaced (yellow), and "h" and "d" are incorrect. I will use this to form a new guess.
My previous attempts included invalid words. I will now use a valid word that incorporates "c," "r," and "o" while avoiding invalid letters.
The feedback shows that "o" is correct and in the right position (green), "r" is correct but misplaced (yellow), and "t" and "s" are incorrect. I will use this to refine my guess.
The feedback indicates that "o" is correct but misplaced, and "r" is correct but misplaced. I will avoid using "t" and try a new arrangement of "r" and "o" while introducing new letters.
